title: Six Tips to Make Your Android Phone Unique to You
sub_head: Google’s mobile OS has more ways to personalize a device than Apple’s iOS does for iPhones. Here are a few to start with.
body:
Whether you’re Team iPhone or Team Android, there is one argument that is hard to dispute: Android devices have always been easier to personalize than their fruit-emblazoned competitors.
While Apple Inc. has gradually opened up iOS to let users tweak parts of an iPhone’s look and feel, the mobile OS from Alphabet Inc.’s Google has long given users ways to adjust lock screens, app layouts, themes and more. And Android 12, the update released in October, has new customization tools.
